alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 1:01PM PST until December 06 at 12:45PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... South Fork Stillaguamish River Near Jordan Rd. Bridge affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rainfall is mostly ended in the north central Cascades, but residual runoff, possibly with a small addition of lower elevation snow melt has kept the Stillaguamish River rising and close to a record stage. For the North West Region...including Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River at Arlington. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause severe record flooding. Deep and swift flood waters will inundate many roads including Highway 530...Marine Drive and Norman Rd and residential areas in Silvana...Norman... Florence...and Stanwood. Levees are subject to overtopping and damage. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the river basin. This stage on the Stillaguamish corresponds to a Phase 4 in the Snohomish County flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:35 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 21.1 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:35 PM PST Tuesday was 21.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting now at near 21.1 ft. and is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.16 feet on 12/12/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 915 PM PST.
